item.title: Brent petrol murder: Man guilty of killing wife in arson attack
item.description: Damion Simmons doused Denise Keane-Simmons in petrol then set her on fire inside her home.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca killed as legal row ends
item.description: A destruction order is carried out on the alpaca that tested positive for bovine TB.

item.title: Disabled girl, 10, in three-year wait for new wheelchair, says dad
item.description: The father of the severely disabled child is worried her back is being damaged as a result.

item.title: Humpback whale breaches off Isles of Scilly
item.description: The humpback whale is thought to have been attracted to the area by large shoals of sardines.

item.title: Cambridge University college master resigns over handling of sex complaints
item.description: An inquiry recommends a college takes disciplinary action against its master Dr Jeremy Morris.

item.title: Naked Attraction London bus ads to be removed
item.description: The advert was criticised on social media as "tone deaf" with passengers at risk of sexual assault.

item.title: Drummer, 11, plays with Foo Fighters at LA gig
item.description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

item.title: Liverpool man trapped in Afghanistan pleads for help
item.description: The Liverpool taxi driver travelled to the country about two weeks ago to help his family flee.

item.title: Tribute paid to Farnborough taxi driver killed in Kabul attack
item.description: Mohammad Niazi, from Hampshire, died alongside his wife and three-month-old daughter.

item.title: Pictures show devastation caused by Leamington Spa plastics fire
item.description: Emergency services said they have still been unable to enter the site to search for a missing man.

item.title: A19 fatal crash: Speeding driver who reached 120mph is jailed
item.description: Mark Thompson is jailed for causing the death of his friend in a crash on the A19 two years ago.

item.title: Barefoot walker Matt Scott completes Bob Graham Round in 55 hours
item.description: Matt Scott walked the Bob Graham Round barefoot in memory of his mother Angela.

item.title: Feminist Collages London: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
item.description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Metâ€™s top women officers over the last six months.

item.title: Decades of hoarding made house 'a no-go area'
item.description: A woman who struggled with buying and hoarding "bargains" for 30 years explains how it began.

item.title: Afghanistan events 'raw and emotional' for veterans
item.description: Military veteran Nick Wilson says the current Afghanistan crisis is affecting those who fought there.

item.title: Manchester Pride exhibition to reveal stories of freedom
item.description: The audio recordings and portraits form part of a weekend of cultural events to celebrate Pride.

item.title: Harry Kane: England captain has 'clear conscience' after Manchester City transfer saga
item.description: England captain Harry Kane says he has a "clear conscience" after a potential move to Manchester City from Tottenham Hotspur failed to materialise.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo to Man Utd: 'I'm back where I belong' and dedicates return to Sir Alex Ferguson
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo says he is "back where I belong" at Manchester United and dedicates his return to the club to former boss Sir Alex Ferguson.

item.title: County Championship: Josh Bohannon leads Lancashire response against Warwickshire
item.description: Josh Bohannon hits his sixth County Championship half-century of the summer as dogged Lancashire reply to Warwickshire's 371.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey becomes Great Britain's joint most successful Paralympian with 16th gold
item.description: Sarah Storey becomes Great Britain's joint most successful Paralympian of all time after winning her 16th gold medal in the C5 time trial in Tokyo.
